Furthermore, the stage of Buddhahood is a certain state.

This stage of Buddhahood is endowed with all supreme characteristics, all merits are completely fulfilled, it has already reached the ultimate limit of everything, and there is no other superior state beyond this.

Herein, one should know that the Pure Dharma Realm is the suchness of all dharmas, the unerring intrinsic nature, the correct cause of all dharmas, and is able to give rise to the Buddhas and the wisdom of the Buddhas, free from all obstructions and defilements, establishing the dharani gates of samadhi, as well as the immeasurable merits and wisdom of all practices, accomplishing the affairs of benefiting and delighting all sentient beings, and so forth, up to maturing the seeds of hearing and knowing all true dharmas, and thus attaining accomplishment in these and other such characteristics.
As for the wisdom of the Buddhas, it refers to the four wisdoms.

First, the great perfect mirror wisdom. This wisdom is far removed from the characteristics of self and what belongs to the self, and is free from the discriminations of subject and object. It is unmixed with all afflictions and defilements, and is not forgetful or ignorant regarding the characteristics of all objects, activities, and knowables. The reflections of wisdom arise and manifest, supported by the seeds.
It is the pure support of all omniscience, which is the nondiscriminating wisdom that takes suchness as its object.
